mdRecord.dcterms:title: Great Industrial and Agricultural Exposition at Richmond, Virginia
The Great Industrial and Agricultural Exposition at Richmond, Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sheppard, William Ludwell, 1833-1912
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Harper's Weekly
mdRecord.dcterms:description: 1. Exterior of the main building. 2. A Glimpse of the Art Hall. 3. The Colonial or Brandon Room. 4. Stonewall Jackson's horse, Tree split by cannon-shot from Fredericksburg, and other war relics. 5. Colonial coat of arms of Virginia. 6. Colonial and Revolutinary Relics. 7. Cottage made of cereals. 8. Objects made of tobacco or cigarettes. 9. The Weed in Blossom. 10. Making cheroots. 11. Redoubt of Richmond defences in front of Exposition Grounds
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Agricultural exhibitions -- Virginia -- Richmond
Richmond (Va.) -- Buildings, structures, etc.
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: James Branch Cabell Library. Special Collections and Archives
mdRecord.dcterms:source: Original periodical illustration: The Great Industrial and Agricultural Exposition at Richmond, Virginia, Harper's Weekly, Oct. 20, 1888, p. 792, Richmond, Virginia Maps and Prints Collection, M 190, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University.
